cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F.
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
3. In a shallow dish, combine the breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
4. Dip each chicken breast in the beaten eggs, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture.
5. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
6. Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and top each piece with marinara sauce and a slice of mozzarella cheese.
7. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve hot, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese and fresh herbs, if desired.

ingredients: 1 pound beef sirloin, cut into thin strips
cooking_method:
1. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium-high heat. Add the beef strips and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
2. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, sauté the onion and mushrooms until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute.
5. Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir until coated.
6. Gradually pour in the beef broth, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a boil and thickens.
7. Return the beef to the skillet and stir to combine with the sauce.
8. Reduce the heat to low and stir in the sour cream until heated through.
9. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Serve hot, over cooked egg noodles or rice, if desired.

ingredients: 1 lb jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
cooking_method:
1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
2. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for an additional minute.
3. Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder and cook for another minute, stirring constantly.
4. Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until pink and cooked through.
5. Stir in the coconut milk and simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce thickens slightly.
6. Season with salt to taste.
7. Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken, cut into pieces
cooking_method:
1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
2. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for an additional minute.
3. Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder and cook for another minute, stirring constantly.
4. Add the chicken and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until browned on all sides.
5. Add the tomatoes, green chilies, bay leaf, cardamom pods, and cinnamon stick and cook for another 5-7 minutes, or until the tomatoes have softened.
6. Stir in the yogurt, garam masala, sugar, and lemon juice and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the chicken is fully cooked.
7. Season with salt to taste.
8. Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

ingredients: 4 hilsa fish steaks, cleaned and sliced
cooking_method:
1. Marinate the hilsa fish steaks in turmeric and salt for 15-20 minutes.
2. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for an additional minute.
4. Add the mustard paste, yogurt, red chili powder, green chilies, bay leaf, cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, and sugar, and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly.
5. Add the marinated hilsa fish steaks to the skillet and coat with the mustard sauce. Cook for 5-7 minutes on each side, or until the fish is cooked through.
6. Stir in the water and lemon juice and simmer for 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
7. Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice.

ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, rinsed and drained
cooking_method:
1. In a large bowl, marinate the chicken pieces with yogurt, turmeric, red chili powder, ginger paste, garlic paste, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 2 hours.
2. In a large pot, heat ghee and oil over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds, cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, cloves, and bay leaves. Fry until fragrant.
3. Add the sliced onions and fry until lightly browned.
4. Add the marinated chicken pieces and fry until the chicken is cooked through.
5. Add the rice and fry for 2-3 minutes.
6. Add 4 cups of water and bring it to a boil.
7. Reduce heat to low, cover the pot with a lid, and simmer until the rice is cooked and the water has evaporated.
8. In a separate pan, fry the sliced almonds and raisins until lightly browned.
9. Once the rice is cooked, add the fried almonds and raisins, and garam masala. Mix well.
10. Serve hot with raita or any other side dish of your choice.

ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice, rinsed and drained
1 cup red lentils, rinsed and drained
cooking_method:
1. In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and fry until golden brown.
2. Add cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric, red chili powder, garlic, and ginger. Fry for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add the rice and lentils and fry for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add 3 cups of water and bring it to a boil.
5. Reduce heat to low, cover the pot with a lid, and simmer until the rice and lentils are cooked and the water has evaporated.
6. In a separate pan, heat ghee over medium heat. Add bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, and cardamom pods. Fry for 1-2 minutes.
7. Once the rice and lentils are cooked, add the fried spices and salt to taste. Mix well.
8. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with raita or any other side dish of your choice.

1. In a mixing bowl, add glutinous rice flour, salt, cardamom powder, and baking powder. Mix well.
2. Add hot water slowly and mix with a spoon or spatula until the dough comes together.
3. Knead the dough on a clean surface for 5-10 minutes until it becomes smooth and pliable.
4. In a separate bowl, mix together the granulated sugar, grated coconut, and sesame seeds.
5. Take a small portion of the dough and make a ball. Flatten it with your fingers and add a small amount of the sugar-coconut-sesame mixture in the center.
6. Fold the edges of the dough over the filling and shape it into a ball again.
7. Repeat the process with the rest of the dough.
8. In a steamer, bring water to a boil. Grease a steamer basket or banana leaf with vegetable oil.
9. Place the shaped dough balls in the steamer basket or on the banana leaf.
10. Steam for 15-20 minutes until the pithas are cooked and firm to the touch.
11. Remove from the steamer and serve warm or at room temperature.

1. In a mixing bowl, add ground beef, onion, cilantro, tomato paste, besan, ginger paste, garlic paste, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
2. Knead the mixture with your hands for 5-10 minutes until it becomes smooth and pliable.
3. Divide the mixture into 8-10 equal portions and shape each portion into a flat patty.
4. In a frying pan, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
5. Add the meat patties to the pan and cook for 4-5 minutes on each side until they are browned and cooked through.
6. Remove from the pan and serve hot with mint chutney or yogurt sauce.

2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
3. In a shallow dish, combine the breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
4. Dip each chicken breast in the beaten eggs, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture.
5. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
6. Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and top each piece with marinara sauce and a slice of mozzarella cheese.
7. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve hot, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese and fresh herbs, if desired.
